title: Skateducate Website
description: Website for Skateducate, a volunteer-driven organization dedicated to building a supportive community for girls interested in skateboarding. The site, developed in WordPress, provides resources, event information, and a platform to connect and empower young female skaters.

title: Gravel Website
description: A personal project: a website dedicated to gravel cycling. The site aims to promote the sport, share tips and routes, and inspire newcomers to experience the adventure and freedom of gravel biking.

title: Period - informativ website
description: In collaboration with the STENO Museum and a fellow student, I developed an educational web app about menstruation. The project aims to break taboos and provide accessible, age-appropriate information for middle school students. Optimized for iPad Pro, the site features interactive content and resources for both students and teachers.

title: Radar - Responsiv website
description: An individual project: a fully responsive website for Radar Fælleskab, an organization dedicated to fostering community and networking opportunities for young people aged 15-25. The site emphasizes user experience, accessibility, and modern design to ensure everyone can participate and connect.

title: ZeroBuzzBrew - Responsiv website
description: A group project to design and build a website for a fictional brewery, ZeroBuzzBrew. The site is tailored to engage young audiences, promote alcohol-free social events, and create a sense of belonging through creative branding and interactive features.

title: Poul Duedahl - Plakat
description: Poster design for an author evening featuring Poul Duedahl, created in collaboration with A3 Aktiv Alder. The poster aims to attract attendees, highlight the author’s achievements, and encourage community participation in cultural events.

title: Else Lerche Olsen - Plakat
description: Poster design for an author evening with Else Lerche Olsen, developed together with A3 Aktiv Alder. The design is intended to promote the event, celebrate the author’s work, and inspire people of all ages to join in literary and cultural activities.
